Package brickdestroy.ball

Class Ball

java.lang.Object
brickdestroy.ball.Ball
All Implemented Interfaces:
BallInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
BigBall, RubberBall
public abstract class Ball
extends java.lang.Object
implements BallInterface
This is the class used to represent the ball object in the Brick Game. Maintenance and Refactoring Activities - The original code consisted of passing in two radii (radiusA and radiusB) for the "makeBall" method, however this is redundant and makes the code harder to understand. I have refactored the code by creating one single parameter called 'radius'. This performs the same functionality as the the ball will be having one radius only. The makeBall() method has been moved to BallInterface in order to make the implementation of makeBall() method easier to read. The ball class now implements the BallInterface. The "center", "up", "down", "left" and "right" variables of the ball are made private and accessible via getters in order to improve encapsulation within the class. The initial speed of the ball is now set in the constructor itself than from another class. Created by filippo on 04/09/16.

  • Constructor Details

    • Ball

      public Ball​(java.awt.geom.Point2D center, int radius, java.awt.Color inner, java.awt.Color border)
      This is the constructor for the Ball Object to represent the ball. The 4 coordinates of the edges of the ball are assigned here (up, down, left and right). The face of the ball is set here. The color (inner and border) of the ball is set here.
      Parameters:
      center - Point2D type, center holds the x and y coordinate of the ball's center.
      radius - Integer type, radiusA holds the radius of the ball.
      inner - Color type, inner holds the ball's inside color.
      border - Color type, border holds the ball's outside color.

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move()
      This method is focused on having the ball move freely as the game begins.

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo​(java.awt.Point p)
      This method is used to move the ball back to the spawn point after ball is lost or when new level is begun.
      Parameters:
      p - The Point is the location we want the ball to be spawned from on reset.

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed​(int x, int y)
      This method is used to set the speed of the ball along both axes.
      Parameters:
      x - The speed at which the ball moves along the x-axis.
      y - The speed at which the ball moves along the y-axis.
